reviews.review_msg: Make sure to attend lectures even though he pretty much sums up the textbook. TESTS ARE SUPER TOUGH. Make sure to do the exercises in the textbook and pre-read before class.  Try to stay away from this course if you're looking for an easy, GPA booster. This is the opposite. Just make sure to study a lot for tests.

A class you will either love or hate, either way he's a great prof. Your mark is made up of 4 tests so all you have to do is attend lectures and read a chapter every week or two. Test material is based off of lectures and the textbook. Lectures are much more clear and interesting than the book but VERY similar. Adds test infoexamples in lectures
Sticks with the textbook, makes studying for midterms straightfoward. Final exam is considerably harder than midterms. Can be a huge jerk if he's feelin it. TA, Simon, is reeeeally odd.

Katz is a great speaker and gives really clear examples. While his class is basically him speaking for the full 50 minutes, he keeps you engaged in the material. Constantly references the textbook (I think he has a thing for the author). Might be the smartest prof on campus. Avoid the TA, Simon Polluk, at all costs. Weird and annoying guy.

Half of the material is really interesting and the other half is nonsense if your not a phil major. Katz himself is a great speaker and can really keep you interested considering its a 9.30 class. If you KNOW you like phil, you should consider taking him, but choose another if you just need your engl/phil credits.

The class has 3 midterms and one take home final. Final is actually extremely hard, expect to spend at least 10 hours on 4 pages. Get Katz as your TA. His TA Jesus, is hard to understand and provides little help.

Hard course if you aren't good at math or don't have an interest in Philosophy (like me). However Katz is a pretty nice guy and does his best to help you out. Pay attention in lectures as those seem to be what he bases his exams on. 4 tests worth 25% each, hard to get a high mark on them, but if you study/do textbook exercises it's possible.

If you are a ESL student or a first year student, don't take it. There are 3 midterm and 1 final, each worth 25% (you do the math..there is no participation marks or assignment marks.) The test is quite tricky and hard to get full mark on a question. Plus, you only have 50min to write it. The only good thing is that the final is a take home exam.

He's a good prof and not difficult at all. Except, don't think that you can take philxx1 as an easy quantitative credit and avoid doing math because the class requires mathematical thinking. Also, taking math 12 will make this course a whole lot easier.

Terrible teacher yes she does explain content if needed, but if you don't get it she isn't supportive. Office hours do not help; TAs are mildl more helpful.  If you are taking PHILxx1 for the Q credit, I recommend you to drop that thought. I thought that I would learn something interesting in this course.
piece of shieet prof. avoid at all cost

Dr. Mc gives lots of examples which is really helpful when trying to understand the concepts. That being said, whenever someone gets the answer to a question wrong, she tends to be rather condescending rather than helpful. There are weekly assignments which help you keep up with the lessons, but overall it's a pretty tough and confusing course.
her final made me cry
her notes are basically useless and she's extremely rude and condescending. never take a class with her, especially not phil xx1!
Her notes aren't specific and they are pretty vague. BAD PROF. NEVER EVER TAKE PHIL XX1!

Most difficult class I've ever taken. Unnecessarily difficult for a first year course and WILL kill your sem GPA. Literally the only C I've ever gotten, and that's coming from a straight A student. Avoid at all costs. Lectures are convoluted and confusing. I only passed thanks to my TA. Jill literally RIPS the exam away from you when time's up.

Horrible lecturer. Not clear whatsoever. Easier to just read the textbook. Even that won't help though, tests are unbelievably difficult and very tricky. Never take this class, especially as a first year course, it is not a GPA booster.

This Professor is condescending, unhelpful, spiteful and rude. She makes everything on the exam tricky, with a section of multiple choice with a twist! Make sure you understand everything before taking this class because it definitely is not an introduction. She is a dragon lady so don't ask questions in class or else she will humiliate you.

Uses a the text "Reason and Argument", but tells you to disregard certain parts of it because "We'll be doing things a little differently...".  Overall she is a very confusing prof, and really teaches the course to her own accord. A very different course than when a friend of mine took it the semester before.

She doesn't follow 100% with the textbook which makes it hard to fully understand the material. Her lecture notes aren't always super specific so resources are limited. The assignments are hard but they are credit or no credit so they are easy marks.
She's fine but THE TEXTBOOK IS SO DISORGANIZED. Ugh. I think they are changing it so that's good. It's not too bad final was kinda hard though.

I found prof Mc to actually be one of the better profs, she keeps her lectures interesting for the most part and is always organized, prepared and finishes on time. The course material itself can be tricky but for those who have a very logical thought process it should be fairly straight forward. All in a great prof but don't expect an easy A.

Worst professor I have had as of yet. She is completely confusing, looks down upon students, and she rarely corresponds to the textbook. The material she covers is displayed in a very confusing and disorganized manner. Avoid her if possible. She's boring and annoying.
Midterms and Final is unreasonably hard and confusing and tricky. Theres so many places where u can get marks off. GPA killer!

The course is hard in itself, but the professor is very helpful and she put forward her ideas pretty clearly. The mid-terms are not easy, but if you are a regular to her lectures, you'll do just fine.
This course is too hard!!  The material is just too hard to understand. Try to avoid phil xx1 if possible.

An example midterm question (I wish I was kidding) If most ppl like the olympics, then most vancouverites ride bicycles, since most plumbers are electricians only if most vancouverites ride bicyces, and unless it's false that most ppl love the olympics, then most plumbers are electricians. If you understand this, stay. If you don't, LEAVE NOW!!!!!!

I tried handing in an assignment the day it was due to her before class. She yelled at me for not handing it in her box even though she would be collecting this assignment in 5 minutes.  That pretty much describes her.  Save your money. Trust me

She makes it sound very easy with no-brainer examples(with lame names too) but then the exams are completely beyond what is possible. I totally understood the textbook and her notes and everything and managed to do TERRIBLE. Made my gpa look pretty bad
HORRIBLE CLASS I'VE EVER TAKEN

Do not take this class just for a Q requirement! It is my most difficult class, the material is boring and a struggle to sit and read. Midterms seem unrelated to work covered in class, I dread to think what the final will be like. McIntosh herself is very helpful in emails, TA does try but not being able to speak English fluently is a major problem

Decent teacher, horrible use of text. Horrid exams that does not reflect on lecture notes, but rather in a philosophy textbook that's near impossible to stay awake reading. My advice is to stay away from her XX1, because it's definitely no GPA booster.

I thought the Prof had a good lecture style, and also made it clear that she was available for help. HOWEVER, the exams were much too difficult when compared with the material and questions we studied in class. A little ridiculous for a 100 level class. This one is just an added stress with no reward.

I suggest that anyone not interested in getting a degree in phil stay away from this course at all costs. It will drop your GPA. The prof is great but her notes nor the textbook can help you understand. The material in this class makes no sense and exams are very hard. The class average is always 45%...BEWARE
VERY HARD, I recommend no one take her classes, her tests is going to destroy your GPA.
Notes are amazing, no need for textbook except for homework questions. The course itself is hard, cant blame the prof. My TA, Shula, was helpful, provided great examples that were on the midterms.

This course is too hard, and this is not her fault. She is a very good prof and very organized. Her notes are very helpful, but midterms and finals are still hard. The material is just too hard to understand. Try to avoid phil xx1 if possible. It's very very helpful if you have previous exams.

good prof, difficult course. did pretty well only because of the bell curve... class avgs are very low. practice is necessary because tests are extremely tricky! try to get old MTs from your friends, it will help a lot.
I wont say shes bad at teaching or anything, just I never understand how the midterm average be that low..( most people fail ) queations are way to tricky

She teaches the material really well and yes her tests can be tricky but she and the TA's emphasize this and even point out the ways she's going to trick you, so you should be able to do well. Just follow her notes and the readings and go to tutorials - you'll get sample test q's that show the patterns she follows - always the samet type of qs.

I'm very good at writing courses, but was abysmal at highschool math. This course is effectively... well.. algebra. It's construction of logical arguments via math-ish alebraic formulae. If you don't have a mind for 'abstract' concepts, such as those from math or science, DO NOT take this class. Nice professor, but purposely tries to trick you.

Very Well preparared prof with an awesome personality. Some people say the course is hard, i say it requires more than just memorization. Must be logical to succeed in coursem, cant just memorize everything... Tests may be tricky, but its all pretty simular to lecture material. So study lecture notes.

She is a fairly good prof; organized, funny, and explains the text well. Her exams though are another story. They are tricky!!!!! Don't let the lectures fool you, this class is harddddddd. class avg was approx 50%.
No Comments
The ratings here are childish. Grow up. Dr Mc is a great professor. Her midterms are fair and she gives us partial notes so we don't have to write out everything.
No Comments

very nice prof, and very clear and organized. gives partial notes making it easy to follow in class. you always expect to get better on the midterm than you actually do, must pay a lot of attention to wording of the questions. the text was easy to read. i thought the course was pretty easy, many people tend to have trouble with it though.
She's a very nice professor. Her midterms are fair. One of the few courses I can stay awake in.

she is very nice, and her notes are awesomes. I think her notes are much more helpful than the text. However there are some memorization and be familiar with all the material. He tests are not hard, but it is difficult enough because the time is so limitted. I suggest you boost up your writting speed before taking this course
GPA BOOSTER =)!
kinda hard to understand. her notes are not very organized.. and hard to catch up.
Good professor. Lectures are interesting. Don't let that fool you...  Exams are v tough..  Negative marking for complicated Multiple choice questions..  65% is C and the class average was 60%

This professor changed my entire academic career. I walked into PHIL XX1 hating math and logic, and I walked out redirecting my entire philosophy major towards logic.  He's an absolutely amazing prof!! So smart, really helpful, and he has a great sense of humor.  Definitely will look for him in the future. Feel lucky to have him at SFU :)

He is so funny and he keeps lectures interesting. His office is almost always open for help and he really does care about all of his students. The course itself is quite difficult but Nic tries to make it as clear as possible. The professor is amazing but the course sucks.
Lovely prof! Textbook is unnecessary and useless, all you need is his lectures. The first part of the course was easy, then the second part of the course killed me (arts student here).
Nic is honestly the best.  His slides are so useful that the textbook is quite useless.  Super funny prof, and it'd be 10x more enjoyable if it's not a morning class

it's a difficult subject & course, but he does a good a job to make it easier. Gives good notes (cept u have to copy them urself,but thats the part that helps u remember anyway).Exams are tough, but it's all from the notes, it just takes quite a bit of thinking to get the ans. He gives out $$ sometimes for answering questions correctly in class!!

This class was not hard, as long as you're willing to put the time into memorizing formulas and applying them to things. This class was way more mathematical in nature than philosophical. Test and assignments were 100% logic, but lectures were very dry. Not the most interesting person to listen to, nor the most interesting topic.

This professor seems to miss the logic that when 80% of his students get below 50% on the exams and assignments, that means HE'S doing something wrong, not that 80% of his students are stupid.  His lectures are  great, but his exams are written to purposely bring down your GPA.  In short, skip any class he's teaching, for your ego & GPA.

I agree with most people here that Horban knows what he is doing and he probably is very smart person. HOWEVER, (THIS IS MY PERSONAL OPINION) I think he is somewhat **** in terms of answering questions or attending his officer hours to ask questions.  Alo, I think he is the one of the professors that works very hard to lower the average.

Had him in Fall 08. Very clear with explaining concepts. Easier to understand him than the text. Tutorial (at least my TA) wasn't very helpful. Exams can be a little tricky but can do well at them if u fully understand the concepts. Doing practices will help prepare for exams. Assignments were simple and for completion marks only.

clear prof, very very hard tests, overall his notes are very well organized. One of his TA's is HORRIBLE. i dont kno about the other TA's but my TA did nothing but talk about how he dated models and stuff

I have him for both PHIL XX1 AND PHIL 110. He's a pretty good prof. Attend all lectures and copy down the notes he gave in lecture and you won't even need to bother wasting your time to read the textbook.
Great teacher, but hard course.
This guy is good
reallyyyyy good prof...lectures are very interesting..twice he gave 5$ bills out of his pocket to random students...though course is kinda though but uld enjoy it
He's an easy prof..there's 2 midterm and final exam, and he practically just gives you 10% for homework because it's based on completion. Exams are tricky, you must study the notes.
Insanely hard exams.

He is extremely smart and his lecture + notes are surprisingly Helpful & Clear. All you need to do is to attend his lectures regularily and use his notes to study. You don't need to study the textbook..all you need to do is just study his lecture notes. His lecture notes are way better & clear than textbook. He is an awesome prof. !!

Peter is a gentleman but picky. For people who are good at math, this course is fairly easy. But get high marks in midterms doesn't mean you are good enough. I still do not know how he grades students. A lot of students think they deserve better, like people who were supposed to get A finally got A- instead.

One of my favorite pro. His notes are really helpful(suggest you copy one from your friends who have taken his course before class). TA Daisy are nice and helpful. Be careful about time during the midterm, and the final is much more harder than midterm. Overall, I love him.

He is a nice prof. He prepares all the notes for you and you dont really need the text at all. But his exams are extremely hard. If you really understand his lecture notes, you will be fine. Also, make sure u have his past exams as many as you can cauz they are very helpful. I got a B- in his class. This class has a very discouraging avg...45%!!
heavy inclass note-taking. very helpful tutorials. use time wisely during midterms. hw marks are given out according to effort (all or nothing).
you can tell he's interested in what he's teaching so it makes you want to listen. otherwise, this course contains useless information

He was pretty good. VERY THOROUGH! Very particular as well. I didn't think that the multiple choice where possibly more than one answer was correct was fair, and there were trick questions on the exams, but otherwise it was an ok class. Definitely pay attention to details and don't try to make it harder than it is.

His midterms are stupidly hard and very dicouraging. With sections where u can actually lose marks. THe lectures are long and boring and very difficult to understand. Questions are pointless and time consuming. Midterm averages are about 50% and that is what he expects. Very discouraging for a fist year student.
He has clear notes, lectures aren't too boring, but his midterms are super hard, be prepared to work hard in his class.

I absolutely loved Professor Horban.  He explained philosophy concepts really well.  All his notes were on the overhead and that made it really easy.  I always sucked at anything to do with the arts, but this course is very black and white and isn't hard to do well in if you try (although midterm average was about 40%, but don't be discouraged!)
explains every thing realy well, but hates people that dont come to his lectures (that only listen to the recordings)
His exams are really hard. But dun worry about the grades b/c he curves. I like his lec b/c his lec is very clear and logic. He's a good prof~ I'm waiting for him to teach PHIL 100.
Horban was a TA to the author of the text he uses, also helped write it, so unfortunately both his lectures and text are very convoluted in spots, and untangling this can be a nightmare.
this class is easy... do his past midterms and u'll get A+..

He is a great prof and a very knowledgeable one! However, I don't like his midterms!! His final was quite hard as well. You really gotta study! Wouldn't recommend taking this class if you are a first year!
Assignments are not hard. You can easily get 44 just by reading the ppt. Midterms are not easy. The final today was really long and hard. But the class is curved. Most students will get C or C+.

Amazing prof! He's very knowledgable, a great lecturer, and he's really nice if you ask for help.  Yeah, he's tough, but Philosophy isn't exactly what you should be taking if you're looking for an easy A.  Put some work into it (by that  i mean a lot), and you'll do fine. Plus his voice is absolutely amazing, so lectures are pleasant to attend.

Well, just want to let you know the avg of the midterm is around 48%, so you know how hard it is right? The multiple multiple choice section is very very tricky. The second half of the course focuses more on statistics, I am taking BUEC 232 this term so It helps a lot. I think my BUEC 232 prof makes the concept clearer than him.

Love this prof and his american accent, he can really draw your attention with tons of examples. But be careful of his brutal exams, you really need to study for it. Not recommend to year 1 student to take it, since it will most likely kick you butt.

Wouldn't recommend this course. It was nothing like what I expected, especially since half the course is math/statistics. Take 100 or 120 if you need PHIL credit. Heide overall was pretty good, not very helpful though, and his exams are pretty harsh. Of the known XX1 profs he is probably your best bet though
Dai Heide's lectures are such a pleasant to attend. He explains well with a little bit of humor, so just pay attention and you'll do fine !

This prof really seems to know what he is talking about! This course kicks the ass of anyone who thinks it'll be an easy pass, you have to go to lectures and do the readings to get by even though attendance isn't marked. Lots of people were re-taking it, but they obviously never paid attention. Work hard and you'll be fine!

The reason why everyone says this is a hard course is because they expected PHIL to be a cake walk but its not. Exams require you study but this is a fair, although tricky course. Best PHIL prof by far, if you need this course, don't take it with anyone else
Cool dude. Easy course material but tricky exams if you dont study. Wouldn't recommend as an elective but if you need this course for your major, you MUST take it with Dai!
His exams are way too hard for a first year intro PHIL course. But by the looks of the other ratings for PHIL profs on here, this is the man if you want any chance of succeeding

Excellent lecturer but exams are extremely hard. However, since its curved, all you really need to do is stay above the class average which is usually around 50%. Tests should have been more reasonable but Dai was great at teaching the material

He gives outstanding and interesting lectures. Reviewing his lectures is "positively correlated" to succeeding in this class. You will do well in this class 'if and only if" you study. My argument is valid. PS: His voice is phenomenal.

I've heard some bad things about PHIL profs at SFU but Dai was excellent, the only bad thing about him is that his exams are unreasonably hard. I spent 3 hours a week studying for this course and only managed a C. Very difficult but I found it interesting. Might end up re-taking this because it brought down my GPA
He's a good prof but do not take this this class if you don't need to. Total GPA flunker
An interesting course overall, prof is great but his tests are ridiculously hard and very hard to get an A. Just passing a test is considered a good mark.

The material itself is pretty easy, he is very helpful and provides good lecture notes, but his midterms and final are the hardest tests I've ever taken at SFU. Test averages are usually in the 40's to low 50's. Don't take this class if your looking for a easy GPA booster, but if your interested I would highly recommend taking it. And he's soo hot!

Very interesting class, and I like the prof. Great set of lecture slides, really helpful for studying afterwards. Even though it was a hard class, I enjoyed it and found it interesting. Highly recommended, just don't be expecting to get a easy high mark out of it.

For people less philosophically inclined or that have never taken a phil class before, material is somewhat difficult to grasp at first, but is possible to understand with lots of studying and a good TA. But here is nothing anyone can do for the midterms. He's pretentious but his good looks make up for it. I would not recommend taking this class.

Dr. Heide is a great lecturer, really funny and makes things easy to understand. Attendance to lectures is not mandatory until around 2nd midterm time because he stops using the textbook. Midterms are impossible, so don't beat yourself up. . . 50% is amazing. Good luck.
He's a great professor, it's just the fact that his tests are so hard. The average for the midterm was like 48%. It's definitely a hard course but I find it rather interesting because of Dai.

His power-points are very clear, easy to sit through and helpful. The midterm was a lot more difficult than I expected so make sure you study hard. A good TA will help you do well in this class. Definitely not a GPA booster but it is a really interesting class.

i got past exams from a frd and it was extremely easy, who would of thought he would make it so hard this year? final was out of 247 if i remember correctly, not enough time to finish the exams. definetely NOT a gpa booster.

The material seems very easy in lecture, until you get to the exams. There are hardly any practice questions to do and for the ones there are, they are NOTHING like the exam questions. Studied my butt off and didn't do as well as I would expect. He's a decent prof, the exams are just unfair.
An interesting course focusing on logic in philosophy. Course material was easy to understand but exam questions can be quite complicated ...

His class is interesting, I'll give him that. However, midterms were really tricky (multiple choice with multiple answers needed to be chosen to be right? wtf?) and not enough time to finish. Can pretty much just study his lecture notes to do alright in course. This course is pretty hard.. it's like math with words, though it is interesting

Lecture slides were really useful.  His lectures were informative and easy to sit through. Only complaint was that one of the midterms was too long, and did not allow enough time to finish. Otherwise, he is very clear and easy to understand. Assignments are easy and the final was easy if you study an adequate amount.
6 short assignments; 2 midterms and 1 final.  Midterms were extremely long; not enough time to write them especially the last part (reconstructing argument). TA was a tough marker...
easy class; easy prof! His lectures are always consistent with textbook!

Very engaging. Studying lecture notes are all you really need to do to prepare for his exams, although they were harder than expected. TA's mark VERY unfairly with assignments. Reading the textbook provides a lot of clarity with certain concepts. One of my easier classes for sure! Definitely reccoment this class for first years

He is a really good prof! He knows what he's talking about and is very clear! Uses a lot of sports examples :) If you don't have a good TA you will not do well because they mark the midterms. STUDY STUDY STUDY for his exams/midterms as I found them somewhat difficult.
handsome, sexy pro. like him
Favorite professor from this semester. He's real chill and knows what he is talking about. Would strongly recommend him. FYI: his voice = SO SEXY
hot in a geeky way

Super cool guy, lot of sports metaphors, but he's cute, nice, & teaches well. I went to him during his office hours and he lent me a book about something I was interested in! Genuinely likes teaching.
no comment

DO NOT take her class!! She makes the class way more difficult than it needs to be.. her exams are really hard! She doesnt give enough examples in class, just goes over the concepts! She yelled at us during the exam/midterm for not staying in our seats at the end of the exam! Drastically lowered my CGPA

I came to hand in an assignment on the day that it was due.  She asked that we hand it in her box if we couldnt find her.  Just before class i caught up with her and said here is the assignment that is due today. She yelled at me for not handing it in her box even though She would be collecting that assignment 5 min from when i gave it to her.

Really difficult class if you're not a phil-minded student. TA's were the saving grace but even then not much could be done. Twisted multiple choice killed every exam mark (would have done much higher if not for that). And the little things mean alot when answering questions-so be careful. Not recommended as an "Easy Q" class because it's not!
Other things were okay but "Twisted" questions were terrible!!!! I kind of screwed this course...............Strongly recommend to get helps from TA

Her lectures are as simple and lame as the textbook. Phil really depends if u understand and can twist and play around with the concepts, but as a teacher, she doesn't help your understanding or reasoning to ideas. She basically use lame examples that undermine the course. Be prepared for her examples being about everyone failing the class...

Test way to hard compared to the style of teaching. A fair amount of the class was about statistics (no math needed, just the concepts like correlation) which was surprising. Fairly easy material but you need to know it inside and out for the tests and this can be tricky.

This is a tough course to begin with but Prof Mc does the best she can to make it easier. It's important you go to class and ESPECIALLY tutorials (they help a lot). It might be tough to get a good mark...I think a C+ is the department avg and it's a very scaled class. Reading the textbook and doing the assignments helps too.
Material is not too hard but I find it hard to do well (like get As and Bs for raw score) simply because there is too little time to write the test.
Classes were fine; tests were much too difficult for material studied.
No Comments
No Comments
Awesome teacher.. was able to make some dry material interesting.. super cool guy too.. this class is not a gpa booster but if you work hard its not gonna hurt you

Great prof! Very encouraging. Super clear lectures and always there to help. If you attend lecture you will have no surprises in the exam. Having said that, you need to study well to get a good grade. This class is NOT a GPA booster. It is more like a GPA maintainer but definitely take it with him!

What a great guy, his enthusiasm for what would normally be very dry material made the class worth coming to. He was always available for extra help and very understanding of those with difficulties. He even made an extra office hour session before the final for review. If you have to take this class, make sure he is your prof!
AMAZING hands down. if you read/attend, show effort, you will get gd mark. the best teacher ever.
